<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// is evaluated to UNDEF), or returns VAL otherwise. Note that each</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// read of UNDEF can yield different value, but FREEZE(UNDEF) cannot.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ad3b50b6d74957b19afb85ac29f66afef"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ad3b50b6d74957b19afb85ac29f66afef">FREEZE</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="225"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// EXTRACT&#95;ELEMENT - This is used to get the lower or upper (determined by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="226"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// a Constant, which is required to be operand #1) half of the integer or</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="227"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// float value specified as operand #0.  This is only for use before</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="228"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// legalization, for values that will be broken into multiple registers.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="230"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="231"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// BUILD&#95;PAIR - This is the opposite of EXTRACT&#95;ELEMENT in some ways.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="232"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Given two values of the same integer value type, this produces a value</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// twice as big.  Like EXTRACT&#95;ELEMENT, this can only be used before</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// legalization. The lower part of the composite value should be in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// element 0 and the upper part should be in element 1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a41bd84b853e2c03fb1af1f4ca9ebdcaf"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a41bd84b853e2c03fb1af1f4ca9ebdcaf">BUILD&#95;PAIR</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="264"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="265"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// CARRY&#95;FALSE - This node is used when folding other nodes,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="267" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110acc20c926003b2af97ba08689176e7130"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110acc20c926003b2af97ba08689176e7130">CARRY&#95;FALSE</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="268"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="269"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Carry-setting nodes for multiple precision addition and subtraction.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="270"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// These nodes take two operands of the same value type, and produce two</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="271"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// results.  The first result is the normal add or sub result, the second</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="272"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// result is the carry flag result.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="273"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// FIXME: These nodes are deprecated in favor of UADDO&#95;CARRY and USUBO&#95;CARRY.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00274" /><CodeLine lineNumber="274"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// They are kept around for now to provide a smooth transition path</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00275" /><CodeLine lineNumber="275"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// toward the use of UADDO&#95;CARRY/USUBO&#95;CARRY and will eventually be removed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00276" /><CodeLine lineNumber="276" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a20084f62caecb0db80ad71bdabda73c2"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a20084f62caecb0db80ad71bdabda73c2">ADDC</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00277" /><CodeLine lineNumber="277" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a2ab6db512a611d1ef4ff8069e2bbfd0d"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a2ab6db512a611d1ef4ff8069e2bbfd0d">SUBC</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="278"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00279" /><CodeLine lineNumber="279"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Carry-using nodes for multiple precision addition and subtraction. These</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00280" /><CodeLine lineNumber="280"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// nodes take three operands: The first two are the normal lhs and rhs to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="281"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the add or sub, and the third is the input carry flag.  These nodes</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00282" /><CodeLine lineNumber="282"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// produce two results; the normal result of the add or sub, and the output</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="283"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// carry flag.  These nodes both read and write a carry flag to allow them</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="284"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// to them to be chained together for add and sub of arbitrarily large</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="285"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// values.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="286" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ad116e32876f2275acf60ffb1651c9256"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ad116e32876f2275acf60ffb1651c9256">ADDE</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="287" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ac9246c101c0cc9232e37b3941194bb13"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ac9246c101c0cc9232e37b3941194bb13">SUBE</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="288"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00289" /><CodeLine lineNumber="289"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Carry-using nodes for multiple precision addition and subtraction.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00290" /><CodeLine lineNumber="290"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// These nodes take three operands: The first two are the normal lhs and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00291" /><CodeLine lineNumber="291"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// rhs to the add or sub, and the third is a boolean value that is 1 if and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00292" /><CodeLine lineNumber="292"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// only if there is an incoming carry/borrow. These nodes produce two</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00293" /><CodeLine lineNumber="293"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// results: the normal result of the add or sub, and a boolean value that is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00294" /><CodeLine lineNumber="294"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// 1 if and only if there is an outgoing carry/borrow.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00295" /><CodeLine lineNumber="295"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00296" /><CodeLine lineNumber="296"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Care must be taken if these opcodes are lowered to hardware instructions</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00297" /><CodeLine lineNumber="297"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// that use the inverse logic -- 0 if and only if there is an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00298" /><CodeLine lineNumber="298"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// incoming/outgoing carry/borrow.  In such cases, you must preserve the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00299" /><CodeLine lineNumber="299"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// semantics of these opcodes by inverting the incoming carry/borrow, feeding</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="300"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// it to the add/sub hardware instruction, and then inverting the outgoing</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="301"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// carry/borrow.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="302"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00303" /><CodeLine lineNumber="303"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The use of these opcodes is preferable to ADDE/SUBE if the target supports</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00304" /><CodeLine lineNumber="304"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// it, as the carry is a regular value rather than a glue, which allows</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="305"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// further optimisation.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="306"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="307"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// These opcodes are different from &#91;US&#93;&#123;ADD,SUB&#125;O in that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="308"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// U&#123;ADD,SUB&#125;O&#95;CARRY consume and produce a carry/borrow, whereas</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="309"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// &#91;US&#93;&#123;ADD,SUB&#125;O produce an overflow.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="310" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ab0f1e3ed26108fec69eb97209c0e39bf"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ab0f1e3ed26108fec69eb97209c0e39bf">UADDO&#95;CARRY</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="311" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ac81ebcd59d629d8680e50ffba9855255"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ac81ebcd59d629d8680e50ffba9855255">USUBO&#95;CARRY</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="312"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="313"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Carry-using overflow-aware nodes for multiple precision addition and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="314"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// subtraction. These nodes take three operands: The first two are normal lhs</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="315"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// and rhs to the add or sub, and the third is a boolean indicating if there</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="316"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// is an incoming carry. They produce two results: the normal result of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="317"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// add or sub, and a boolean that indicates if an overflow occurred (&#42;not&#42;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// flag, because it may be a store to memory, etc.). If the type of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="319"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// boolean is not i1 then the high bits conform to getBooleanContents.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="320" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110af9eda6a77c3228cd36537469a7425133"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110af9eda6a77c3228cd36537469a7425133">SADDO&#95;CARRY</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="321" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a139dc5419039d94496e69dbb264251b5"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a139dc5419039d94496e69dbb264251b5">SSUBO&#95;CARRY</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="322"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="323"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// RESULT, BOOL = &#91;SU&#93;ADDO(LHS, RHS) - Overflow-aware nodes for addition.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="324"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// These nodes take two operands: the normal LHS and RHS to the add. They</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="329"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// These nodes are generated from llvm.&#91;su&#93;add.with.overflow intrinsics.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="330" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a863ec6ebb75bf89cfea14da646d77e92"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a863ec6ebb75bf89cfea14da646d77e92">SADDO</a>,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="332"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="333"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Same for subtraction.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="334" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a6efe16ea597cfd8eeac26516fc992ee7"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a6efe16ea597cfd8eeac26516fc992ee7">SSUBO</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="335" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a4ffc75d65231b55461c0ba4f36a3e500"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a4ffc75d65231b55461c0ba4f36a3e500">USUBO</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="336"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="337"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Same for multiplication.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00567" /><CodeLine lineNumber="567"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// indices. If this condition cannot be determined statically but is false at</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00568" /><CodeLine lineNumber="568"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// runtime, then the result vector is undefined. The IDX parameter must be a</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00570" /><CodeLine lineNumber="570"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// pointer type.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00571" /><CodeLine lineNumber="571"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00572" /><CodeLine lineNumber="572"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This operation supports inserting a fixed-width vector into a scalable</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00644" /><CodeLine lineNumber="644"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// SPLAT&#95;VECTOR&#95;PARTS(SCALAR1, SCALAR2, ...) - Returns a vector with the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00645" /><CodeLine lineNumber="645"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// scalar values joined together and then duplicated in all lanes. This</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00646" /><CodeLine lineNumber="646"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// represents a SPLAT&#95;VECTOR that has had its scalar operand expanded. This</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00647" /><CodeLine lineNumber="647"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// allows representing a 64-bit splat on a target with 32-bit integers. The</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00752" /><CodeLine lineNumber="752" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a601e66a26efd05520f7cb26aef3af340"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a601e66a26efd05520f7cb26aef3af340">CTTZ&#95;ZERO&#95;UNDEF</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00753" /><CodeLine lineNumber="753" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a0340c8d57d1dcebc43a00412989583d3"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a0340c8d57d1dcebc43a00412989583d3">CTLZ&#95;ZERO&#95;UNDEF</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00754" /><CodeLine lineNumber="754"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00755" /><CodeLine lineNumber="755"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Select(COND, TRUEVAL, FALSEVAL).  If the type of the boolean COND is not</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00756" /><CodeLine lineNumber="756"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// i1 then the high bits must conform to getBooleanContents.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00757" /><CodeLine lineNumber="757" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a78d0f198115bfe3331ab7cfcf7a40a97"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a78d0f198115bfe3331ab7cfcf7a40a97">SELECT</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00758" /><CodeLine lineNumber="758"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00759" /><CodeLine lineNumber="759"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Select with a vector condition (op #0) and two vector operands (ops #1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00760" /><CodeLine lineNumber="760"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// and #2), returning a vector result.  All vectors have the same length.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00761" /><CodeLine lineNumber="761"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Much like the scalar select and setcc, each bit in the condition selects</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00762" /><CodeLine lineNumber="762"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// whether the corresponding result element is taken from op #1 or op #2.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00763" /><CodeLine lineNumber="763"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// At first, the VSELECT condition is of vXi1 type. Later, targets may</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00764" /><CodeLine lineNumber="764"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// change the condition type in order to match the VSELECT node using a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00765" /><CodeLine lineNumber="765"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// pattern. The condition follows the BooleanContent format of the target.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00766" /><CodeLine lineNumber="766" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ab0b7d2c769fd0fbaab3c4a2fc8e7ea0c"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ab0b7d2c769fd0fbaab3c4a2fc8e7ea0c">VSELECT</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00767" /><CodeLine lineNumber="767"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00768" /><CodeLine lineNumber="768"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Select with condition operator - This selects between a true value and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00769" /><CodeLine lineNumber="769"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// a false value (ops #2 and #3) based on the boolean result of comparing</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00770" /><CodeLine lineNumber="770"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the lhs and rhs (ops #0 and #1) of a conditional expression with the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00771" /><CodeLine lineNumber="771"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// condition code in op #4, a CondCodeSDNode.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00772" /><CodeLine lineNumber="772" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a99ad6b342b7457df56b91d24e66016b3"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a99ad6b342b7457df56b91d24e66016b3">SELECT&#95;CC</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00773" /><CodeLine lineNumber="773"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00774" /><CodeLine lineNumber="774"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// SetCC operator - This evaluates to a true value iff the condition is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00775" /><CodeLine lineNumber="775"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// true.  If the result value type is not i1 then the high bits conform</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00776" /><CodeLine lineNumber="776"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// to getBooleanContents.  The operands to this are the left and right</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00777" /><CodeLine lineNumber="777"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// operands to compare (ops #0, and #1) and the condition code to compare</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00778" /><CodeLine lineNumber="778"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// them with (op #2) as a CondCodeSDNode. If the operands are vector types</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00779" /><CodeLine lineNumber="779"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// then the result type must also be a vector type.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00780" /><CodeLine lineNumber="780" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a0158ee47dfa868be5d28e2cbef70d5d0"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a0158ee47dfa868be5d28e2cbef70d5d0">SETCC</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00781" /><CodeLine lineNumber="781"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00782" /><CodeLine lineNumber="782"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Like SetCC, ops #0 and #1 are the LHS and RHS operands to compare, but</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00783" /><CodeLine lineNumber="783"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// op #2 is a boolean indicating if there is an incoming carry. This</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00784" /><CodeLine lineNumber="784"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// operator checks the result of &quot;LHS - RHS - Carry&quot;, and can be used to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00785" /><CodeLine lineNumber="785"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// compare two wide integers:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00786" /><CodeLine lineNumber="786"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// (setcccarry lhshi rhshi (usubo&#95;carry lhslo rhslo) cc).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00787" /><CodeLine lineNumber="787"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Only valid for integers.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00788" /><CodeLine lineNumber="788" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a6bb33e400f29724907dc27ced04e9038"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a6bb33e400f29724907dc27ced04e9038">SETCCCARRY</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00789" /><CodeLine lineNumber="789"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00790" /><CodeLine lineNumber="790"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// SHL&#95;PARTS/SRA&#95;PARTS/SRL&#95;PARTS - These operators are used for expanded</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00793" /><CodeLine lineNumber="793"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///     &#91;Lo,Hi&#93; = op &#91;LoLHS,HiLHS&#93;, Amt</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00794" /><CodeLine lineNumber="794" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110aeb80f9832dad739ee9c6deaa3110d98f"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110aeb80f9832dad739ee9c6deaa3110d98f">SHL&#95;PARTS</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00795" /><CodeLine lineNumber="795" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a78139be59781ad05e1698eb95c58e0b1"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a78139be59781ad05e1698eb95c58e0b1">SRA&#95;PARTS</a>,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00797" /><CodeLine lineNumber="797"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00798" /><CodeLine lineNumber="798"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Conversion operators.  These are all single input single output</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00800" /><CodeLine lineNumber="800"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// wider or narrower (depending on the operation) than the source</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00801" /><CodeLine lineNumber="801"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// type.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00802" /><CodeLine lineNumber="802"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00803" /><CodeLine lineNumber="803"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// SIGN&#95;EXTEND - Used for integer types, replicating the sign bit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00804" /><CodeLine lineNumber="804"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// into new bits.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00805" /><CodeLine lineNumber="805" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a5183f3d72924bc7c77ba8d3f5de9f602"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a5183f3d72924bc7c77ba8d3f5de9f602">SIGN&#95;EXTEND</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00806" /><CodeLine lineNumber="806"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00807" /><CodeLine lineNumber="807"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// ZERO&#95;EXTEND - Used for integer types, zeroing the new bits. Can carry</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00815" /><CodeLine lineNumber="815"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00816" /><CodeLine lineNumber="816"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// TRUNCATE - Completely drop the high bits.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00817" /><CodeLine lineNumber="817" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ae690127648393001a7d5b93dc23da7b3"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ae690127648393001a7d5b93dc23da7b3">TRUNCATE</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00818" /><CodeLine lineNumber="818"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// TRUNCATE&#95;&#91;SU&#93;SAT&#95;&#91;SU&#93; - Truncate for saturated operand</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00819" /><CodeLine lineNumber="819"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// &#91;SU&#93; located in middle, prefix for &#96;SAT&#96; means indicates whether</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00820" /><CodeLine lineNumber="820"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// existing truncate target was a signed operation. For examples,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00821" /><CodeLine lineNumber="821"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If &#96;truncate(smin(smax(x, C), C))&#96; was saturated then become &#96;S&#96;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00822" /><CodeLine lineNumber="822"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If &#96;truncate(umin(x, C))&#96; was saturated then become &#96;U&#96;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00823" /><CodeLine lineNumber="823"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// &#91;SU&#93; located in last indicates whether range of truncated values is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00824" /><CodeLine lineNumber="824"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// sign-saturated. For example, if &#96;truncate(smin(smax(x, C), C))&#96; is a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00825" /><CodeLine lineNumber="825"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// truncation to &#96;i8&#96;, then if value of C ranges from &#96;-128 to 127&#96;, it will</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00826" /><CodeLine lineNumber="826"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// be saturated against signed values, resulting in &#96;S&#96;, which will combine</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00827" /><CodeLine lineNumber="827"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// to &#96;TRUNCATE&#95;SSAT&#95;S&#96;. If the value of C ranges from &#96;0 to 255&#96;, it will</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00828" /><CodeLine lineNumber="828"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// be saturated against unsigned values, resulting in &#96;U&#96;, which will</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00829" /><CodeLine lineNumber="829"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// combine to &#96;TRUNCATE&#95;SSAT&#95;U&#96;. Similarly, in &#96;truncate(umin(x, C))&#96;, if</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00830" /><CodeLine lineNumber="830"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// value of C ranges from &#96;0 to 255&#96;, it becomes &#96;U&#96; because it is saturated</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00831" /><CodeLine lineNumber="831"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// for unsigned values. As a result, it combines to &#96;TRUNCATE&#95;USAT&#95;U&#96;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00832" /><CodeLine lineNumber="832" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110af78365e835dbc10df18c1cd5d8853fd0"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110af78365e835dbc10df18c1cd5d8853fd0">TRUNCATE&#95;SSAT&#95;S</a>, </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// saturate signed input to signed result -</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00833" /><CodeLine lineNumber="833"><span class="doxyHighlight">                   </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// truncate(smin(smax(x, C), C))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00834" /><CodeLine lineNumber="834" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a694c9a71596643f6ddd4ee767666cf43"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a694c9a71596643f6ddd4ee767666cf43">TRUNCATE&#95;SSAT&#95;U</a>, </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// saturate signed input to unsigned result -</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00835" /><CodeLine lineNumber="835"><span class="doxyHighlight">                   </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// truncate(smin(smax(x, 0), C))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00836" /><CodeLine lineNumber="836" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110af81ec85e716e986c5555135612f62b29"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110af81ec85e716e986c5555135612f62b29">TRUNCATE&#95;USAT&#95;U</a>, </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// saturate unsigned input to unsigned result -</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00837" /><CodeLine lineNumber="837"><span class="doxyHighlight">                   </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// truncate(umin(x, C))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00838" /><CodeLine lineNumber="838"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00839" /><CodeLine lineNumber="839"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// &#91;SU&#93;INT&#95;TO&#95;FP - These operators convert integers (whose interpreted sign</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00844" /><CodeLine lineNumber="844"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// SIGN&#95;EXTEND&#95;INREG - This operator atomically performs a SHL/SRA pair to</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00851" /><CodeLine lineNumber="851"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// ANY&#95;EXTEND&#95;VECTOR&#95;INREG(Vector) - This operator represents an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00852" /><CodeLine lineNumber="852"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// in-register any-extension of the low lanes of an integer vector. The</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00853" /><CodeLine lineNumber="853"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// result type must have fewer elements than the operand type, and those</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00854" /><CodeLine lineNumber="854"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// elements must be larger integer types such that the total size of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00855" /><CodeLine lineNumber="855"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// operand type is less than or equal to the size of the result type. Each</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00856" /><CodeLine lineNumber="856"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// of the low operand elements is any-extended into the corresponding,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00857" /><CodeLine lineNumber="857"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// wider result elements with the high bits becoming undef.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00858" /><CodeLine lineNumber="858"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// NOTE: The type legalizer prefers to make the operand and result size</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00859" /><CodeLine lineNumber="859"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the same to allow expansion to shuffle vector during op legalization.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00860" /><CodeLine lineNumber="860" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110aaa275bf149ab5df1067cfb721936ecbc"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110aaa275bf149ab5df1067cfb721936ecbc">ANY&#95;EXTEND&#95;VECTOR&#95;INREG</a>,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00862" /><CodeLine lineNumber="862"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// SIGN&#95;EXTEND&#95;VECTOR&#95;INREG(Vector) - This operator represents an</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00865" /><CodeLine lineNumber="865"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// elements must be larger integer types such that the total size of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00866" /><CodeLine lineNumber="866"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// operand type is less than or equal to the size of the result type. Each</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00867" /><CodeLine lineNumber="867"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// of the low operand elements is sign-extended into the corresponding,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00871" /><CodeLine lineNumber="871" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a3893859b5caa079593b9bf91b96e05fb"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a3893859b5caa079593b9bf91b96e05fb">SIGN&#95;EXTEND&#95;VECTOR&#95;INREG</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00872" /><CodeLine lineNumber="872"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00873" /><CodeLine lineNumber="873"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// ZERO&#95;EXTEND&#95;VECTOR&#95;INREG(Vector) - This operator represents an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00874" /><CodeLine lineNumber="874"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// in-register zero-extension of the low lanes of an integer vector. The</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00875" /><CodeLine lineNumber="875"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// result type must have fewer elements than the operand type, and those</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00876" /><CodeLine lineNumber="876"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// elements must be larger integer types such that the total size of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00877" /><CodeLine lineNumber="877"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// operand type is less than or equal to the size of the result type. Each</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00878" /><CodeLine lineNumber="878"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// of the low operand elements is zero-extended into the corresponding,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00879" /><CodeLine lineNumber="879"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// wider result elements.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00880" /><CodeLine lineNumber="880"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// NOTE: The type legalizer prefers to make the operand and result size</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00881" /><CodeLine lineNumber="881"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the same to allow expansion to shuffle vector during op legalization.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00882" /><CodeLine lineNumber="882" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110adf7f4fc30c272a1987e075d7470df84c"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110adf7f4fc30c272a1987e075d7470df84c">ZERO&#95;EXTEND&#95;VECTOR&#95;INREG</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00883" /><CodeLine lineNumber="883"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00884" /><CodeLine lineNumber="884"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// FP&#95;TO&#95;&#91;US&#93;INT - Convert a floating point value to a signed or unsigned</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00885" /><CodeLine lineNumber="885"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// integer. These have the same semantics as fptosi and fptoui in IR. If</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00886" /><CodeLine lineNumber="886"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the FP value cannot fit in the integer type, the results are undefined.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00887" /><CodeLine lineNumber="887" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ac3f8f8d8437c64b2e2e9f978e2707210"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ac3f8f8d8437c64b2e2e9f978e2707210">FP&#95;TO&#95;SINT</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00888" /><CodeLine lineNumber="888" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a71640703ec096a8b07111e85cfff6987"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a71640703ec096a8b07111e85cfff6987">FP&#95;TO&#95;UINT</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00889" /><CodeLine lineNumber="889"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00890" /><CodeLine lineNumber="890"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// FP&#95;TO&#95;&#91;US&#93;INT&#95;SAT - Convert floating point value in operand 0 to a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00891" /><CodeLine lineNumber="891"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// signed or unsigned scalar integer type given in operand 1 with the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00892" /><CodeLine lineNumber="892"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// following semantics:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00893" /><CodeLine lineNumber="893"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00894" /><CodeLine lineNumber="894"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///  &#42; If the value is NaN, zero is returned.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00895" /><CodeLine lineNumber="895"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///  &#42; If the value is larger/smaller than the largest/smallest integer,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00896" /><CodeLine lineNumber="896"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///    the largest/smallest integer is returned (saturation).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00897" /><CodeLine lineNumber="897"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///  &#42; Otherwise the result of rounding the value towards zero is returned.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00898" /><CodeLine lineNumber="898"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00899" /><CodeLine lineNumber="899"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The scalar width of the type given in operand 1 must be equal to, or</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00900" /><CodeLine lineNumber="900"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// smaller than, the scalar result type width. It may end up being smaller</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00901" /><CodeLine lineNumber="901"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// than the result width as a result of integer type legalization.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00902" /><CodeLine lineNumber="902"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00903" /><CodeLine lineNumber="903"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// After converting to the scalar integer type in operand 1, the value is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00904" /><CodeLine lineNumber="904"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// extended to the result VT. FP&#95;TO&#95;SINT&#95;SAT sign extends and FP&#95;TO&#95;UINT&#95;SAT</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00905" /><CodeLine lineNumber="905"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// zero extends.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00906" /><CodeLine lineNumber="906" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ae4a4e2126c6db34e2dfd71b6bd0408ee"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ae4a4e2126c6db34e2dfd71b6bd0408ee">FP&#95;TO&#95;SINT&#95;SAT</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00907" /><CodeLine lineNumber="907" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a98661814400e72a77f5ed4e088c06937"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a98661814400e72a77f5ed4e088c06937">FP&#95;TO&#95;UINT&#95;SAT</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00908" /><CodeLine lineNumber="908"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00909" /><CodeLine lineNumber="909"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// X = FP&#95;ROUND(Y, TRUNC) - Rounding &#39;Y&#39; from a larger floating point type</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00910" /><CodeLine lineNumber="910"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// down to the precision of the destination VT.  TRUNC is a flag, which is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00911" /><CodeLine lineNumber="911"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// always an integer that is zero or one.  If TRUNC is 0, this is a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00912" /><CodeLine lineNumber="912"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// normal rounding, if it is 1, this FP&#95;ROUND is known to not change the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00913" /><CodeLine lineNumber="913"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// value of Y.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00914" /><CodeLine lineNumber="914"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00915" /><CodeLine lineNumber="915"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The TRUNC = 1 case is used in cases where we know that the value will</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00916" /><CodeLine lineNumber="916"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// not be modified by the node, because Y is not using any of the extra</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00917" /><CodeLine lineNumber="917"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// precision of source type.  This allows certain transformations like</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00918" /><CodeLine lineNumber="918"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// FP&#95;EXTEND(FP&#95;ROUND(X,1)) -&gt; X which are not safe for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00919" /><CodeLine lineNumber="919"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// FP&#95;EXTEND(FP&#95;ROUND(X,0)) because the extra bits aren&#39;t removed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00920" /><CodeLine lineNumber="920" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110adaf9a3cb5c2ef5eb713bd6bf4ae23aeb"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110adaf9a3cb5c2ef5eb713bd6bf4ae23aeb">FP&#95;ROUND</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00921" /><CodeLine lineNumber="921"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00922" /><CodeLine lineNumber="922"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Returns current rounding mode:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00923" /><CodeLine lineNumber="923"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// -1 Undefined</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00924" /><CodeLine lineNumber="924"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///  0 Round to 0</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00925" /><CodeLine lineNumber="925"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///  1 Round to nearest, ties to even</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00926" /><CodeLine lineNumber="926"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///  2 Round to +inf</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00927" /><CodeLine lineNumber="927"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///  3 Round to -inf</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00928" /><CodeLine lineNumber="928"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///  4 Round to nearest, ties to zero</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00929" /><CodeLine lineNumber="929"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///  Other values are target dependent.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00930" /><CodeLine lineNumber="930"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Result is rounding mode and chain. Input is a chain.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00931" /><CodeLine lineNumber="931" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a89f3afc3fa907ff83759c6c76d97a973"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a89f3afc3fa907ff83759c6c76d97a973">GET&#95;ROUNDING</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00932" /><CodeLine lineNumber="932"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00933" /><CodeLine lineNumber="933"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Set rounding mode.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00934" /><CodeLine lineNumber="934"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The first operand is a chain pointer. The second specifies the required</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00935" /><CodeLine lineNumber="935"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// rounding mode, encoded in the same way as used in &#39;&#96;&#96;GET&#95;ROUNDING&#96;&#96;&#39;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00936" /><CodeLine lineNumber="936"><span class="doxyHighlight">  SET&#95;ROUNDING,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00937" /><CodeLine lineNumber="937"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00941" /><CodeLine lineNumber="941"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// BITCAST - This operator converts between integer, vector and FP</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00942" /><CodeLine lineNumber="942"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// values, as if the value was stored to memory with one type and loaded</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00943" /><CodeLine lineNumber="943"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// from the same address with the other type (or equivalently for vector</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00944" /><CodeLine lineNumber="944"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// format conversions, etc).  The source and result are required to have</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00945" /><CodeLine lineNumber="945"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the same bit size (e.g.  f32 &lt;-&gt; i32).  This can also be used for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00946" /><CodeLine lineNumber="946"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// int-to-int or fp-to-fp conversions, but that is a noop, deleted by</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00948" /><CodeLine lineNumber="948"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00949" /><CodeLine lineNumber="949"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This operator is subtly different from the bitcast instruction from</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00950" /><CodeLine lineNumber="950"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// LLVM-IR since this node may change the bits in the register. For</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00951" /><CodeLine lineNumber="951"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// example, this occurs on big-endian NEON and big-endian MSA where the</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1024"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// FMINNUM/FMAXNUM - Perform floating-point minimum or maximum on two</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1025"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// values.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1026"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1027"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// In the case where a single input is a NaN (either signaling or quiet),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1028"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the non-NaN input is returned.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1029"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1030"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The return value of (FMINNUM 0.0, -0.0) could be either 0 or -0.0.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1031"><span class="doxyHighlight">  FMINNUM,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1032"><span class="doxyHighlight">  FMAXNUM,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1033"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1034"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// FMINNUM&#95;IEEE/FMAXNUM&#95;IEEE - Perform floating-point minimumNumber or</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1035"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// maximumNumber on two values, following IEEE-754 definitions. This differs</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1036"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// from FMINNUM/FMAXNUM in the handling of signaling NaNs, and signed zero.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1037"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1038"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If one input is a signaling NaN, returns a quiet NaN. This matches</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1039"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// IEEE-754 2008&#39;s minnum/maxnum behavior for signaling NaNs (which differs</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1040"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// from 2019).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1041"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1042"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// These treat -0 as ordered less than +0, matching the behavior of IEEE-754</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1043"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// 2019&#39;s minimumNumber/maximumNumber.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1044"><span class="doxyHighlight">  FMINNUM&#95;IEEE,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1045"><span class="doxyHighlight">  FMAXNUM&#95;IEEE,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1046"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1047"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// FMINIMUM/FMAXIMUM - NaN-propagating minimum/maximum that also treat 0</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1048"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// as less than 0.0. While FMINNUM&#95;IEEE/FMAXNUM&#95;IEEE follow IEEE 754-2008</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1049"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// semantics, FMINIMUM/FMAXIMUM follow IEEE 754-2019 semantics.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1050"><span class="doxyHighlight">  FMINIMUM,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1051"><span class="doxyHighlight">  FMAXIMUM,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1052"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1053"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// FMINIMUMNUM/FMAXIMUMNUM - minimumnum/maximumnum that is same with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1054"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// FMINNUM&#95;IEEE and FMAXNUM&#95;IEEE besides if either operand is sNaN.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1055"><span class="doxyHighlight">  FMINIMUMNUM,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1056"><span class="doxyHighlight">  FMAXIMUMNUM,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1057"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1058"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// FSINCOS - Compute both fsin and fcos as a single operation.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1059"><span class="doxyHighlight">  FSINCOS,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1060"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1061"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Gets the current floating-point environment. The first operand is a token</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1062"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// chain. The results are FP environment, represented by an integer value,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1063"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// and a token chain.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1064"><span class="doxyHighlight">  GET&#95;FPENV,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1065"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1066"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Sets the current floating-point environment. The first operand is a token</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1067"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// chain, the second is FP environment, represented by an integer value. The</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1068"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// result is a token chain.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1069"><span class="doxyHighlight">  SET&#95;FPENV,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1070"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1071"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Set floating-point environment to default state. The first operand and the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1072"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// result are token chains.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1073"><span class="doxyHighlight">  RESET&#95;FPENV,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1074"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1075"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Gets the current floating-point environment. The first operand is a token</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1076"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// chain, the second is a pointer to memory, where FP environment is stored</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1077"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// to. The result is a token chain.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1078"><span class="doxyHighlight">  GET&#95;FPENV&#95;MEM,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1079"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1080"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Sets the current floating point environment. The first operand is a token</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1081"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// chain, the second is a pointer to memory, where FP environment is loaded</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1082"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// from. The result is a token chain.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1083"><span class="doxyHighlight">  SET&#95;FPENV&#95;MEM,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1084"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1085"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Reads the current dynamic floating-point control modes. The operand is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1086"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// a token chain.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1087"><span class="doxyHighlight">  GET&#95;FPMODE,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1088"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1089"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Sets the current dynamic floating-point control modes. The first operand</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1090"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// is a token chain, the second is control modes set represented as integer</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1091"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// value.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1092"><span class="doxyHighlight">  SET&#95;FPMODE,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1093"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1094"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Sets default dynamic floating-point control modes. The operand is a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1095"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// token chain.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1096"><span class="doxyHighlight">  RESET&#95;FPMODE,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1097"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1098"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// LOAD and STORE have token chains as their first operand, then the same</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1099"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// operands as an LLVM load/store instruction, then an offset node that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1100"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// is added / subtracted from the base pointer to form the address (for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1101"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// indexed memory ops).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1102"><span class="doxyHighlight">  LOAD,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1103"><span class="doxyHighlight">  STORE,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1104"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1105"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// DYNAMIC&#95;STACKALLOC - Allocate some number of bytes on the stack aligned</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1106"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// to a specified boundary.  This node always has two return values: a new</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1107"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// stack pointer value and a chain. The first operand is the token chain,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1108"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the second is the number of bytes to allocate, and the third is the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1109"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// alignment boundary.  The size is guaranteed to be a multiple of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1110"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// stack alignment, and the alignment is guaranteed to be bigger than the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1111"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// stack alignment (if required) or 0 to get standard stack alignment.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1112"><span class="doxyHighlight">  DYNAMIC&#95;STACKALLOC,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1113"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1114"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Control flow instructions.  These all have token chains.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1115"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1116"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// BR - Unconditional branch.  The first operand is the chain</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1117"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// operand, the second is the MBB to branch to.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1118"><span class="doxyHighlight">  BR,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1119"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1120"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// BRIND - Indirect branch.  The first operand is the chain, the second</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1121"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// is the value to branch to, which must be of the same type as the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1122"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// target&#39;s pointer type.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1123"><span class="doxyHighlight">  BRIND,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1124"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1125"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// BR&#95;JT - Jumptable branch. The first operand is the chain, the second</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1126"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// is the jumptable index, the last one is the jumptable entry index.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1127"><span class="doxyHighlight">  BR&#95;JT,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1128"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1129"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// JUMP&#95;TABLE&#95;DEBUG&#95;INFO - Jumptable debug info. The first operand is the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1130"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// chain, the second is the jumptable index.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1131"><span class="doxyHighlight">  JUMP&#95;TABLE&#95;DEBUG&#95;INFO,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1132"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1133"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// BRCOND - Conditional branch.  The first operand is the chain, the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1134"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// second is the condition, the third is the block to branch to if the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1135"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// condition is true.  If the type of the condition is not i1, then the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1136"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// high bits must conform to getBooleanContents. If the condition is undef,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1137"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// it nondeterministically jumps to the block.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1138"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// TODO: Its semantics w.r.t undef requires further discussion; we need to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1139"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// make it sure that it is consistent with optimizations in MIR &amp; the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1140"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// meaning of IMPLICIT&#95;DEF. See https://reviews.llvm.org/D92015</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1141"><span class="doxyHighlight">  BRCOND,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1142"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1143"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// BR&#95;CC - Conditional branch.  The behavior is like that of SELECT&#95;CC, in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1144"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// that the condition is represented as condition code, and two nodes to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1145"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// compare, rather than as a combined SetCC node.  The operands in order</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1146"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// are chain, cc, lhs, rhs, block to branch to if condition is true. If</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1147"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// condition is undef, it nondeterministically jumps to the block.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1148"><span class="doxyHighlight">  BR&#95;CC,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1149"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1150"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// INLINEASM - Represents an inline asm block.  This node always has two</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1151"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// return values: a chain and a flag result.  The inputs are as follows:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1152"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   Operand #0  : Input chain.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1153"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   Operand #1  : a ExternalSymbolSDNode with a pointer to the asm string.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1154"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   Operand #2  : a MDNodeSDNode with the !srcloc metadata.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1155"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   Operand #3  : HasSideEffect, IsAlignStack bits.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1156"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   After this, it is followed by a list of operands with this format:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1157"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///     ConstantSDNode: Flags that encode whether it is a mem or not, the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1158"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                     of operands that follow, etc.  See InlineAsm.h.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1159"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///     ... however many operands ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1160"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   Operand #last: Optional, an incoming flag.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1161"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1162"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The variable width operands are required to represent target addressing</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1163"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// modes as a single &quot;operand&quot;, even though they may have multiple</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1164"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// SDOperands.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1165"><span class="doxyHighlight">  INLINEASM,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1166"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1167"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// INLINEASM&#95;BR - Branching version of inline asm. Used by asm-goto.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1168"><span class="doxyHighlight">  INLINEASM&#95;BR,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1169"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1170"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// EH&#95;LABEL - Represents a label in mid basic block used to track</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1171"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// locations needed for debug and exception handling tables.  These nodes</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1172"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// take a chain as input and return a chain.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1173"><span class="doxyHighlight">  EH&#95;LABEL,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1174"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1175"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// ANNOTATION&#95;LABEL - Represents a mid basic block label used by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1176"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// annotations. This should remain within the basic block and be ordered</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1177"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// with respect to other call instructions, but loads and stores may float</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1178"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// past it.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1179"><span class="doxyHighlight">  ANNOTATION&#95;LABEL,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1180"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1181"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// CATCHRET - Represents a return from a catch block funclet. Used for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1182"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// MSVC compatible exception handling. Takes a chain operand and a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1183"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// destination basic block operand.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1184"><span class="doxyHighlight">  CATCHRET,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1185"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1186"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// CLEANUPRET - Represents a return from a cleanup block funclet.  Used for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1187"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// MSVC compatible exception handling. Takes only a chain operand.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1188"><span class="doxyHighlight">  CLEANUPRET,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1189"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1190"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// STACKSAVE - STACKSAVE has one operand, an input chain.  It produces a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1191"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// value, the same type as the pointer type for the system, and an output</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1192"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// chain.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1193"><span class="doxyHighlight">  STACKSAVE,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1194"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1195"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// STACKRESTORE has two operands, an input chain and a pointer to restore</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1196"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// to it returns an output chain.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1197"><span class="doxyHighlight">  STACKRESTORE,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1198"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1199"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// CALLSEQ&#95;START/CALLSEQ&#95;END - These operators mark the beginning and end</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1200"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// of a call sequence, and carry arbitrary information that target might</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1201"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// want to know.  The first operand is a chain, the rest are specified by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1202"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the target and not touched by the DAG optimizers.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1203"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Targets that may use stack to pass call arguments define additional</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1204"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// operands:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1205"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// - size of the call frame part that must be set up within the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1206"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   CALLSEQ&#95;START..CALLSEQ&#95;END pair,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1207"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// - part of the call frame prepared prior to CALLSEQ&#95;START.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1208"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Both these parameters must be constants, their sum is the total call</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1209"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// frame size.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1210"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// CALLSEQ&#95;START..CALLSEQ&#95;END pairs may not be nested.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1211"><span class="doxyHighlight">  CALLSEQ&#95;START, </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Beginning of a call sequence</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1212"><span class="doxyHighlight">  CALLSEQ&#95;END,   </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// End of a call sequence</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1213"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1214"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// VAARG - VAARG has four operands: an input chain, a pointer, a SRCVALUE,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1215"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// and the alignment. It returns a pair of values: the vaarg value and a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1216"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// new chain.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1217"><span class="doxyHighlight">  VAARG,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1218"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1219"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// VACOPY - VACOPY has 5 operands: an input chain, a destination pointer,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1220"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// a source pointer, a SRCVALUE for the destination, and a SRCVALUE for the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1221"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// source.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1222"><span class="doxyHighlight">  VACOPY,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1223"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1224"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// VAEND, VASTART - VAEND and VASTART have three operands: an input chain,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1225"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// pointer, and a SRCVALUE.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1226"><span class="doxyHighlight">  VAEND,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1227"><span class="doxyHighlight">  VASTART,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1228"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1229"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// PREALLOCATED&#95;SETUP - This has 2 operands: an input chain and a SRCVALUE</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1230"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// with the preallocated call Value.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1231"><span class="doxyHighlight">  PREALLOCATED&#95;SETUP,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1234"><span class="doxyHighlight">  PREALLOCATED&#95;ARG,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1242"><span class="doxyHighlight">  MDNODE&#95;SDNODE,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1245"><span class="doxyHighlight">  PCMARKER,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1246"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1247"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// READCYCLECOUNTER - This corresponds to the readcyclecounter intrinsic.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1248"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// It produces a chain and one i64 value. The only operand is a chain.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1249"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If i64 is not legal, the result will be expanded into smaller values.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1250"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Still, it returns an i64, so targets should set legality for i64.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1251"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The result is the content of the architecture-specific cycle</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1252"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// counter-like register (or other high accuracy low latency clock source).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1253"><span class="doxyHighlight">  READCYCLECOUNTER,</span></CodeLine>
