<Link id="l01409" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1409"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Generic reduction nodes. These nodes represent horizontal vector</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01410" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1410"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// reduction operations, producing a scalar result.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01411" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1411"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The SEQ variants perform reductions in sequential order. The first</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01412" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1412"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// operand is an initial scalar accumulator value, and the second operand</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01413" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1413"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// is the vector to reduce.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01414" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1414"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// E.g. RES = VECREDUCE&#95;SEQ&#95;FADD f32 ACC, &lt;4 x f32&gt; SRC&#95;VEC</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01415" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1415"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///  ... is equivalent to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01416" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1416"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// RES = (((ACC + SRC&#95;VEC&#91;0&#93;) + SRC&#95;VEC&#91;1&#93;) + SRC&#95;VEC&#91;2&#93;) + SRC&#95;VEC&#91;3&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01417" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1417"><span class="doxyHighlight">  VECREDUCE&#95;SEQ&#95;FADD,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01418" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1418"><span class="doxyHighlight">  VECREDUCE&#95;SEQ&#95;FMUL,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01419" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1419"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01420" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1420"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// These reductions have relaxed evaluation order semantics, and have a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01421" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1421"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// single vector operand. The order of evaluation is unspecified. For</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01422" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1422"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// pow-of-2 vectors, one valid legalizer expansion is to use a tree</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01423" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1423"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// reduction, i.e.:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01424" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1424"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// For RES = VECREDUCE&#95;FADD &lt;8 x f16&gt; SRC&#95;VEC</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01425" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1425"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01426" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1426"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///     PART&#95;RDX = FADD SRC&#95;VEC&#91;0:3&#93;, SRC&#95;VEC&#91;4:7&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01427" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1427"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///     PART&#95;RDX2 = FADD PART&#95;RDX&#91;0:1&#93;, PART&#95;RDX&#91;2:3&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01428" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1428"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///     RES = FADD PART&#95;RDX2&#91;0&#93;, PART&#95;RDX2&#91;1&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01429" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1429"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01430" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1430"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// For non-pow-2 vectors, this can be computed by extracting each element</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01431" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1431"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// and performing the operation as if it were scalarized.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01432" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1432"><span class="doxyHighlight">  VECREDUCE&#95;FADD,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01433" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1433"><span class="doxyHighlight">  VECREDUCE&#95;FMUL,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01434" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1434"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// FMIN/FMAX nodes can have flags, for NaN/NoNaN variants.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01435" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1435"><span class="doxyHighlight">  VECREDUCE&#95;FMAX,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01436" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1436"><span class="doxyHighlight">  VECREDUCE&#95;FMIN,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01437" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1437"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// FMINIMUM/FMAXIMUM nodes propatate NaNs and signed zeroes using the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01438" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1438"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// llvm.minimum and llvm.maximum semantics.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01439" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1439"><span class="doxyHighlight">  VECREDUCE&#95;FMAXIMUM,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01440" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1440"><span class="doxyHighlight">  VECREDUCE&#95;FMINIMUM,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01441" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1441"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Integer reductions may have a result type larger than the vector element</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01442" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1442"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// type. However, the reduction is performed using the vector element type</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01443" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1443"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// and the value in the top bits is unspecified.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01444" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1444"><span class="doxyHighlight">  VECREDUCE&#95;ADD,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01445" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1445"><span class="doxyHighlight">  VECREDUCE&#95;MUL,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01446" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1446"><span class="doxyHighlight">  VECREDUCE&#95;AND,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01447" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1447"><span class="doxyHighlight">  VECREDUCE&#95;OR,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01448" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1448"><span class="doxyHighlight">  VECREDUCE&#95;XOR,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01449" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1449"><span class="doxyHighlight">  VECREDUCE&#95;SMAX,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01450" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1450"><span class="doxyHighlight">  VECREDUCE&#95;SMIN,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01451" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1451"><span class="doxyHighlight">  VECREDUCE&#95;UMAX,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01452" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1452"><span class="doxyHighlight">  VECREDUCE&#95;UMIN,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01453" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1453"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01455" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1455"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Operands: input chain, glue, &lt;id&gt;, &lt;numShadowBytes&gt;, &#91;live0&#91;, live1...&#93;&#93;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01530" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1530"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01531" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1531"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===--------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01532" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1532"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// MemIndexedMode enum - This enum defines the load / store indexed</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01533" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1533"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// addressing modes.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01534" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1534"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01535" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1535"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// UNINDEXED    &quot;Normal&quot; load / store. The effective address is already</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01536" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1536"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///              computed and is available in the base pointer. The offset</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01537" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1537"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///              operand is always undefined. In addition to producing a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01538" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1538"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///              chain, an unindexed load produces one value (result of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01539" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1539"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///              load); an unindexed store does not produce a value.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01540" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1540"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01541" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1541"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// PRE&#95;INC      Similar to the unindexed mode where the effective address is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01542" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1542"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// PRE&#95;DEC      the value of the base pointer add / subtract the offset.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01543" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1543"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///              It considers the computation as being folded into the load /</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01544" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1544"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///              store operation (i.e. the load / store does the address</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01545" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1545"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///              computation as well as performing the memory transaction).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01546" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1546"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///              The base operand is always undefined. In addition to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01547" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1547"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///              producing a chain, pre-indexed load produces two values</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01548" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1548"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///              (result of the load and the result of the address</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01549" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1549"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///              computation); a pre-indexed store produces one value (result</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01550" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1550"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///              of the address computation).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01551" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1551"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01552" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1552"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// POST&#95;INC     The effective address is the value of the base pointer. The</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01553" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1553"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// POST&#95;DEC     value of the offset operand is then added to / subtracted</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01554" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1554"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///              from the base after memory transaction. In addition to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01555" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1555"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///              producing a chain, post-indexed load produces two values</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01556" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1556"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///              (the result of the load and the result of the base +/- offset</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01557" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1557"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///              computation); a post-indexed store produces one value (the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01558" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1558"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///              the result of the base +/- offset computation).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01559" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1559" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#abee7ecb577fcade34eb16ccb7f503e31"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">enum</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#abee7ecb577fcade34eb16ccb7f503e31">MemIndexedMode</a> &#123; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#abee7ecb577fcade34eb16ccb7f503e31ade1c53e7b8a373e22ec53ff7bcbace9f">UNINDEXED</a> = 0, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#abee7ecb577fcade34eb16ccb7f503e31ab5bb854fadd42503c849c4a48d7f3d90">PRE&#95;INC</a>, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#abee7ecb577fcade34eb16ccb7f503e31a57c3822f99653c422d5a21206adc6e42">PRE&#95;DEC</a>, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#abee7ecb577fcade34eb16ccb7f503e31a866c29237765ff291c9503abbdca60e1">POST&#95;INC</a>, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#abee7ecb577fcade34eb16ccb7f503e31a10a4094c81c0b9cd5e82e53b48932203">POST&#95;DEC</a> &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01560" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1560"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01561" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1561" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#ae0010333b4e1424ce473b508d802bbbd"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#ae0010333b4e1424ce473b508d802bbbd">LAST&#95;INDEXED&#95;MODE</a> = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#abee7ecb577fcade34eb16ccb7f503e31a10a4094c81c0b9cd5e82e53b48932203">POST&#95;DEC</a> + 1;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01597" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1597"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ISD::CondCode enum - These are ordered carefully to make the bitfields</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01598" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1598"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// below work out, when considering SETFALSE (something that never exists</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01599" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1599"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// dynamically) as 0  &quot;U&quot; -&gt; Unsigned (for integer operands) or Unordered</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01600" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1600"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// (for floating point), &quot;L&quot; -&gt; Less than, &quot;G&quot; -&gt; Greater than, &quot;E&quot; -&gt; Equal</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01601" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1601"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// to.  If the &quot;N&quot; column is 1, the result of the comparison is undefined if</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01602" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1602"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the input is a NAN.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01603" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1603"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01604" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1604"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// All of these (except for the &#39;always folded ops&#39;) should be handled for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01605" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1605"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// floating point.  For integer, only the SETEQ,SETNE,SETLT,SETLE,SETGT,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01606" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1606"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// SETGE,SETULT,SETULE,SETUGT, and SETUGE opcodes are used.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01607" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1607"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01608" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1608"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Note that these are laid out in a specific order to allow bit-twiddling</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01609" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1609"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// to transform conditions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01610" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1610" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#ac3c3cf58d6d631af6a172457304d3d07"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">enum</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#ac3c3cf58d6d631af6a172457304d3d07">CondCode</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01712" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1712"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// identical values: ((X op1 Y) &amp; (X op2 Y)). This function returns</span></CodeLine>
